brief_description: Tours, the historic capital of the Indre-et-Loire department, is a charming medieval city in the heart of the Loire Valley. With its magnificent Cathédrale Saint-Gatien, beautiful half-timbered houses in the old town, and strategic location as a gateway to the famous châteaux, Tours offers visitors an authentic taste of French medieval heritage, Loire Valley culture, and the distinctive charm of central France.

sections.title: Medieval Heritage
sections.content: Tours' unique character is defined by its exceptional medieval heritage, home to some of the best-preserved medieval architecture in the Loire Valley. The Cathédrale Saint-Gatien, Place Plumereau, and the old town's half-timbered houses create a striking urban identity that showcases the city's importance as a medieval trading center and its continued cultural significance through the centuries.

sections.title: Loire Valley Gateway
sections.content: The city's strategic location in the heart of the Loire Valley makes it the perfect base for exploring the region's famous châteaux, including Château de Chenonceau, Château de Chambord, and Château de Villandry. These magnificent Renaissance palaces tell the story of Tours' importance as a cultural and commercial center in the Loire Valley region.

sections.title: Cultural Traditions
sections.content: Tours is globally recognized as a center of French medieval culture and Loire Valley traditions, which have shaped the city's modern identity. The city's cultural heritage continues to drive innovation, while Tours has evolved into a center for arts, festivals, and French lifestyle, balancing traditional heritage with contemporary urban development.

sections.title: Centre-Val de Loire Identity
sections.content: Tours embodies the warm hospitality and rich traditions of the Centre-Val de Loire region. Visitors experience this through traditional French cuisine featuring local specialties like rillettes, goat cheese, and regional wines, the lively atmosphere of local markets, and the genuine friendliness of residents who are proud to share their city's unique story.

why_visit.intro: Tours offers visitors a unique opportunity to experience a French city that combines medieval heritage with Loire Valley culture, featuring authentic local traditions, fascinating historical sites, and a distinctive central French character that's unlike anywhere else in France.

highlights.title: Medieval Architecture
highlights.content: Tours' distinctive medieval architecture creates a unique urban landscape that's become the city's signature feature. The ancient half-timbered houses, cobblestone streets, and elegant structures transform ordinary streets into striking historical statements, making every street corner a potential photo opportunity and creating a magical atmosphere throughout the city.

highlights.title: Place Plumereau
highlights.content: The heart of Tours, this magnificent medieval square is surrounded by important landmarks including the half-timbered houses, historic buildings, and beautiful medieval architecture. It's the perfect starting point for exploring the city and experiencing the daily life of Tours' residents.

highlights.title: Cathédrale Saint-Gatien
highlights.content: This magnificent Gothic cathedral, located in the historic center, offers spectacular architecture and insights into the city's medieval heritage with its stunning stained glass and cultural significance. The cathedral's design represents the pinnacle of medieval architecture and continues to serve as the spiritual heart of the city.

highlights.title: Vieux Tours
highlights.content: Tours' historic center offers authentic local experiences where visitors can explore narrow cobblestone streets, discover hidden squares, and admire the distinctive medieval and Renaissance architecture. The area is particularly atmospheric in the evening when the historic buildings take on a magical quality against the city backdrop.

highlights.title: Loire Valley Châteaux
highlights.content: In the surrounding region, the iconic châteaux offer spectacular insights into Tours' cultural heritage and the surrounding Loire Valley landscape. Accessible by day trips, they provide a unique perspective on the city's cultural importance and opportunities for architectural appreciation in a historic setting.

highlights.title: French Heritage
highlights.content: The city's cultural heritage is celebrated through its restaurants, markets, and traditional crafts, with the famous French cuisine offering insights into the region's culinary history and the famous Loire Valley wines adding a unique dimension to the city's cultural landscape.

transport.public_transport: Tours has an efficient tram and bus system that serves the city and surrounding areas. Taxis are readily available and the city center is compact and walkable, making it easy to explore on foot.
transport.passes: Single tickets and day passes are available for public transport. The city center is easily navigable on foot, with most major attractions within walking distance.

spring.description: Spring brings pleasant temperatures and blooming flowers to Tours, making it an ideal time to explore the city on foot. The weather is comfortable for outdoor activities, and the surrounding Loire Valley landscape comes to life with seasonal colors.

summer.description: Summer in Tours is warm and sunny, with the city's many parks and the nearby Loire River providing cool retreats. Evening temperatures are comfortable, making it perfect for enjoying the city's vibrant café culture and outdoor dining scene.

autumn.description: Autumn offers mild temperatures and beautiful fall colors, particularly in the surrounding Loire Valley landscape. The weather is ideal for exploring the city and nearby natural attractions, with fewer crowds than the summer months.

winter.description: Winter in Tours is mild and occasionally rainy. The city takes on a cozy atmosphere, with indoor attractions like museums and the historic center providing warm refuge. The nearby Loire Valley countryside offers winter landscape beauty.
